page.title: 01SURVEYS
page.content: We surveyed ninety people in the town centre. From our results we found out that many people did not use buses, but most of those who did thought the service was quite good. Two thirds of the people interviewed both men and women drove cars. Most thought the parking facilities were good a few thought they could be improved. Most people thought the roads could be made safer, especially the double mini roundabout in the town centre. Almost everybody thought the pedestrian crossings could be made safer. Many people thought there should be a bypass built around Dunstable. Most of the people didn't use taxis, those who did, did so regulary.
